scenarioDescription:
The HD 31527 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 31527 is a star with 0.96 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 125.40 light years away from the solar system.

HD 31527 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 31527 system


HD 31527 b

HD 31527 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 31527 b is 10.462 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 31527 b is 3.220 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 31527 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 31527 c

HD 31527 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.27 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 31527 c is 14.151 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 31527 c is 3.850 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 31527 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


HD 31527 d

HD 31527 d was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2019-02, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.81 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 31527 d is 11.830 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 31527 d is 3.460 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 31527 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 31527, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 31527 - System With 3 Exoplanets
